Hi everyone,

In our robot we’re using MK4i swerve modules. When we execute the code, in pathplanner there is a straight path auto. But when we start autonomous mode robot is going forward then backwards and stops. We tried many PID values but it didn’t work.

This is our Pathplanner Telemetry.

image2559×538 96.8 KB

Thanks in advance.

From the graph on the left there it looks like it’s way overshooting on the velocity. If just changing the PID didn’t work, make sure you have good maximum velocity constraints as well and that you’re robot configuration is accurate.

We are in same team and our velocity constraints are well calculated also. I think the main problem is that xy pikes in the graphs. If the pikes reduced problem can be solved. What is your thought?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-18T11:33:25.036Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503318,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line","display_username":"Mete Karadeniz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62434,"username":"Strflightmight","name":"Ezra","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strflightmight/{size}/261969_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68396,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line/503318/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3657196,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-18T13:18:00.404Z","cooked":"

I always suspect incorrect UNITS conversions when there are wild excursions. Also, I didn’t check if your generated TunerConstants are actually used but clearly the numbers appear possibly to be metric when the units are English.

private static final Distance kFrontRightXPos = Inches.of(112.5);
private static final Distance kFrontRightYPos = Inches.of(-112.5);
private static final Distance kWheelRadius = Inches.of(20);

Im not in the lab right now but is this the problem that causes the pikes pr is it just a recommendation for general usage.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-18T13:48:02.174Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":38.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503318,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line","display_username":"Mete Karadeniz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68396,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line/503318/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3657204,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-18T13:54:27.090Z","cooked":"

I wouldn’t call it a recommendation. It’s a requirement that your drivetrain characteristics match the actual robot.

We also found that the wheel force feedforward were causing some jerkiness. You might see some better results if you remove them to start

.withWheelForceFeedforwardsX(feedforwards.robotRelativeForcesXNewtons())
.withWheelForceFeedforwardsY(feedforwards.robotRelativeForcesYNewtons())
","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-18T13:54:27.090Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":42.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503318,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":68396,"username":"irresistiable","name":"Mete Karadeniz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/f19dbf/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line/503318/8","custom_user_title":"78 AIR Strike Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3657206,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-18T14:04:58.711Z","cooked":"

I don’t know what the problem is but you can see that you get big spikes with inappropriate units and conversions.

For example say you want to move 100mm and aren’t using any language UNITS enforcement so you just say 100. But the mechanism is expecting numbers representing units of inches so it actually moves 100 inches.

That’s a big spike (25.4 times too big). With a PID controller - if the target value is correct - the controller sees a huge error and corrects violently the other direction; then that correction is too much so the value goes up again way too much.

For troubleshooting in general check for common errors and those easy to verify first. With low-hanging fruit picked move on to more tedious checking everything with a lot of output statements looking for unexpected or wrong values.

When you are as old as I am and have made most of the possible errors you get more efficient at finding bugs. These apply:
“The master has failed more times than the beginner has tried.”
“A master uses his eyes and ears more than both his hands.”

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-18T14:25:49.262Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":85,"readers_count":84,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503318,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line","display_username":"Mete Karadeniz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19820,"username":"ArchdukeTim","name":"Tim Winters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68396,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line/503318/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3657407,"name":"Ahmet Doruk Gönülal","username":"adg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adg/{size}/248108_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-18T20:05:55.715Z","cooked":"

We used CTRE Phoenix Tuner X software to generate the swerve code. We are sure that we used correct values. But when we saw 117.5 inches of robot width and length we tried the real values like 27.5 inches our robot is 70x70 cm. We tried that and it resulted forwards then backwards then forwards. We tried to change Pathplanner app settings, but it didn’t work really much.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-18T20:05:55.715Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":24.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503318,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line","display_username":"Ahmet Doruk Gönülal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72068,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6429 | electronics, programming"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line/503318/11","custom_user_title":"6429 | electronics, programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3657527,"name":"Ezra","username":"Strflightmight","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strflightmight/{size}/261969_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T00:10:57.495Z","cooked":"

How do the graphs look?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T00:11:15.907Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":62,"readers_count":61,"score":12.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503318,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line","display_username":"Ezra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":72068,"username":"adg","name":"Ahmet Doruk Gönülal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adg/{size}/248108_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 | Programmer, Electronics Lead, and Driver"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-robot-cant-go-straight-line/503318/12","custom_user_title":"5990 | Programmer, Electronics Lead, and Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3657540,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T00:44:05.594Z","cooked":"

It looks like your kWheelRadius, kSpeedAt12Volts, and X/Y positions are all scaled up by a factor of 10 (as 11.25 inches for X/Y sounds reasonable); someone probably typo’d something during generation. Likewise, in your PathPlanner settings.json, your "maxDriveSpeed" is also a factor of 10 too high (copy-pasted from kSpeedAt12Volts). All of your other constants look reasonable, so I would start with scaling all of those down.
